required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diaphragm Ultrasound to Predict Posteroperative Residual Blockade
clinical_study.official_title: Diaphragm Ultrasound to Predict Posteroperative Residual Blockade

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective observational research approved by the Ethics Committee of the Peking Union medical college Hospital. Patients scheduled for elective non-abdominal and non-thoracic surgery among age of 19-65 years and American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status Classification(ASA) I or II were inrolled. Diaphragm ultrasonogram was measured pre and post operation. Diaphragm excursion and diaphragm thickening fraction during quiet breathing as well as deep breathing were assessed. Neuromuscular monitor was performed during operation, after proper calibration.

primary_outcome.description: Neuromuscular function was monitored thoughout operation based neuromuscular monitoring guideline by an independent investigator. TOF ratio before extubation was recorded. The scale of TOFr range from 0 to 1. TOFr<0.9 indicate existance of residual neuromuscular blockade.
Diaphragm excursion and thickening fraction was measured through ultrasonography within 2 min after extubation. Correlation between TOFr ratio and diaphragm parameters was explored.

secondary_outcome.description: If patients cannot breath by themselves after extubation, They need to be reintubated and mechanical ventilation need to be use to sustain their breathing.
incidence of airway obstruction, bronchospasm, pulmonary aspiration of gastric contents, apnea, unexpected ICU admissions, atelectasis and pneumonia

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for elective non-abdominal and non-thoracic surgery in Peking Union medical college hospital. All were among age of 19-65 years and American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status Classification(ASA) I or II.

criteria.textblock:
Enrollment criteria：
1. Patients who were scheduled for elective non-abdominal and non-thoracic surgery in Peking Union medical college hospital.
2. age of 19-65 years
3. American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status Classification(ASA) I or II.
4. Agree to informed consent
Exclusion criteria ： Patients with neuromuscular diseases, diaphragmatic palsy, thoracic malformation, hand disabilities, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, severe liver or kidney diseases, electrolyte or acid-base disorders, morbid obesity (body mass index ≥30 kg/m2), pregnancy, allergy to drugs used in the study, use of medication interfering neuromuscular transmission within 72hours and patients with predicted difficulty in maintenance of airway were excluded from this study. Written informed consent will be obtained before preoperative evaluation by an anesthesiologist.

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology, Peking Union Medical College Hospital
